MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList<Azure.DigitalTwins.Core.Models.ModelData>> CreateModels (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> models, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList`1<class Azure.DigitalTwins.Core.Models.ModelData>> CreateModels(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> models, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overridable Function CreateModels (models As IEnumerable(Of String), Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = null) As Response(Of IReadOnlyList(Of ModelData))

abstract member CreateModels : seq<string> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList<Azure.DigitalTwins.Core.Models.ModelData>> override this.CreateModels : seq<string> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList<Azure.DigitalTwins.Core.Models.ModelData>>

Docs.param: The set of models to create. Each string corresponds to exactly one model.
The cancellation token.
Docs.summary: Creates one or many models synchronously. After the task completes, the result will be set to .
Docs.returns: The created models and the http response.
Docs.remarks: Bulk model creation is useful when several models have references to each other. It simplifies creation for the client because otherwise the models would have to be created in a very specific order. The service evaluates all models to ensure all references are satisfied, and then accepts or rejects the set. So using this method, model creation is transactional.
Docs.exception: The exception that captures the errors from the service. Check the and properties for more details.

Docs.remarks: When a model is decomissioned, new digital twins will no longer be able to be defined by this model. However, existing digital twins may continue to use this model. Once a model is decomissioned, it may not be recommissioned.
